content.description:
This is a very high quality slab climb. From start to finish it is a precarious pebble wrestling match. The crux is near the beginning, where a smearing right foot, right hand micro-crimp and a left-handed thumb catch are the only points of contact to mantle onto the main slab face. Once on the slab be prepared to grit your teeth and pull on what you can.

This route is located in "The Moonscape" area on Fair Island, Newfoundland.
1 to 2 pads and a spot are beneficial.

The crux is in the name. Right from the get go a series of 3 high steps on small foot holds makes the send tricky. With very little to use as hand holds, the rough granite texture is your best friend for topping out. Great warm up problem, where flexibility is key.

This problem is located in "The Moonscape" area on Fair Island, Newfoundland.
1 to 2 crash pads are required. Also, a spot to the left of the boulder is encouraged as the landing is near a drop off.

Start low on the juggy rail. Work over to the right arete where you begin slapping your way up. Finding the right footing for the slaps is the crux, as the balance is tricky. This problem has the potential to place strain on the left shoulder, so be cautious.

This problem is located on the "Ahab" boulder in "The Moonscape" area of Fair Island, Newfoundland.
A single well placed pad and a spot is required.

A juggy sit start flows into a dynamic left handed move to a rail. Once matched, the crux involves a well placed heel hook and a powerful mantling maneuver. With a few additional smears on the slabby top out, this problem can be yours. (Optional: Complete the problem with an unlit cigarette in mouth).

This route is located on the "Ahab" boulder in "The Moonscape" area of Fair Island, Newfoundland.
1 well placed pad and a spot are adequate for this problem.

A long and winding slab climb for the adventurer. Called "Whale of a Tale", as this problem spans up and over the tail-like feature on the "Moby Dick" boulder. Fairly easy start, taking advantage of the thin horizontal crack that runs through the boulder. Once feet are planted in this crack, it is a straight shot to the top smearing and scrambling for the send.

Located on the far right side of the Moby Dick boulder in "The Moonscape" area of Fair Island, Newfoundland.
1 to 2 pads and a spot at the bottom.
A granite beach in a shelter cove. Faces south and receives the most sun of the areas on the island and least wind of coastal areas.
